pages.text: Stromatoporoids are a class of prominent reef-building sponges, hailing from the Ordovician into the Devonian, will possible records going as early as the Carboniferous, and possibly as late as the Late Cretaceous. At their height, they were amongst the most important reef-builders, alongside Rugose and Tabulate Corals, competing and co-existing alongside each other. Although this was not to last, and the stromatoporoids would amost entirely die out during the Hangenberg

event at the end of the Devonian. There are tentative records have been found sporadically in later periods, although most agree that they likely persisted into the Carboniferous at the latest, with the possible Cretaceous forms probably merely bearing strong resemblances to the Stromatoporoids at best.
